H0.text: Plants are the types of organisms whose growth in an area is determined by temperature and precipitation, thereby affecting the animals that live there.

H1.text: Roots are the types of what that can grow in an area, determined by temperature and precipitation, which in turn affect the animals that live there.

H2.text: Buildings are the types of structures that can grow in an area, with their presence determined by temperature and precipitation, and they in turn affect the animals that live there.

H3.text: Birds are the types of organisms that can grow in an area, determined by temperature and precipitation, which in turn affect the animals that live there.

A4.text: Growth is determined by the interaction of a plant's genome with its physical and biotic environment. Factors of the physical or abiotic environment include temperature, water, light, carbon dioxide, and nutrients in the soil.

A5.text: Plants are the primary producers in most terrestrial ecosystems and form the basis of the food web in those ecosystems.
